comment:
Dr. Tomita's classes are a great way to gauge if you should be in this major or not. She will make you practice presentations in every one of her classes, and if you are someone who is uncomfortable with that, you need to either learn how to become comfortable with it via her courses, or accept that this industry isn't for you.

Don't be late btw.

You have several 45sec presentations it's a participation grade. You will have two design mini projects that you do with a partner and combine the two mini projects for the final project. She gives lots of feedback, and make sure to adjust according to the feedback or you will get a poor grade. You will have to get used to the negative feedback.

Dr. Tomita is one of the best professors I have ever had. She is clearly incredibly passionate and cares about her students' success. She has very detailed slides and walks through them during class time which makes it very easy to succeed if you follow her instructions. She has made my experience at KSU infinitely better.

This was the first year this class was taught with everyone being assigned as partners, but don't let that scare you. Since you have a partner, it's less work on one person! This class was very straightforward, as long as you pay attention to her documents telling you what to and not to do.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Overall, class with her is easy and manageable as long as you do the work and go to class. She gives you 5 missed absences before recommending you drop the class. Her lectures consist of PowerPoint presentations that take the entire class time explaining when they could be done in 20 minutes. She is extremely nitpicky and over-explains material.

Professor Tomita is a great teacher but she can come across as harsh. If you are overly sensitive don't take her class. If you show her the effort you are putting in, you'll have no issues with her. She is a very understanding and kind professor, she just doesn't take any BS.

She's honestly my favorite professor in the degree. This is my 2nd time taking her and she great tbh. She records every session and uploads slides so its pretty much an easy A. As long as you follow direction, ask questions if ur lost, and COME TO CLASS. Its literally pretty chill.

While Dr. Tomita's class is fairly easy, Dr. Tomita herself is nitpicky, rude, and condescending. She treats students as though they are 5 years old. I find it very off putting for a professor to take time out of a lecture to yell at those not paying attention, we're all adults able to make our own decisions and deal with the consequences.

-Dr. Tomita goes over assignments during class + extremely detailed slides on assignments
-Post recordings of class on D2L
-Gives 6 absences before it affects ur grades
-U will at most spend 2 hours a week on this class
-She'll call u out if ur late to class, but it's not to humiliate u, it's because she doesn't want u to miss anything important

Dr. Tomita is an amazing professor. She will grade you harshly but she is preparing you for the real world. Although she can be pretty strict, she explains her reasoning well. I highly recommend her to anyone who is looking to learn.

Dr. Tomita was one of the best professors I have ever taken at KSU. She provides detailed instructions and gives you harsh but honest feedback. Dr. Tomita grades very harshly but that is so she can prepare you for the real world. You definitely have to work for your grade in her class but if you do not put in the effort, you will not do well.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment:
Dr. Tomita is hardcore, in the best way possible! She is a hard grader, but this is because she gives very specific  instructions with assignments and expects that we follow them. If you follow the instructions, an easy A. 
Would highly recommend her class if you appreciate organized professors!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She is knowledgeable, and strict, but is preparing us for the field. She gives detailed instructions and feedback so you understand how to do each task. I don't recommend taking this class with more than 12 credits, so manage your time wisely. This class is a good indicator if IAD is right for you. Review her ppts and lectures and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Tomita is a really knowledgeable profesor! There are weekly individual presentations but she gives great feedback on your work. People thinks shes mean but shes just blunt. Just roll with it and make the changes when necessary. Super easy A just be sure to attend class and submit on time.

Her IAD2100 class was incredibly easy. Had an assignment due every Friday, but she posted very detailed instructions on how to do them, and also spends each class showing us how to do them. Super fair grader, also allowed us 6 absences without penalty. If you know how to read directions you won't have a problem with her.

Do every mini presentations! EASY A! Mini projects 1 & 2 are stupid easy. Don't be lazy with them. She is very detailed orientated with the Powerpoints. Do not take criticism personally... it's just critics. She is all business, understandable, and helpful. Anyone to fail or struggle in this class should rethink their major.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Condescending and unhelpful. I reached out for help on numerous occasions and she brushed me off & made it seem like it was my fault for not understanding information. In her words, "For other students I feel that they know the concepts and try to use them, so I am more willing to give them feedback, but I do not feel that from you."
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Tomita is very good at what she does. Her PowerPoints are clear and once you follow them you will pass her class with flying colors since she grades based on what is on the PowerPoint. She can be a bit blunt at times which people dont like but she means well. Weekly easy assignments, 2 mini projects and 1 final project, reflection and presentation
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Every Friday there is an assignment but she gives you a PowerPoint showing you step by step what to do. She's super sweet and knowledgeable. Sometimes it's hard to understand her accent but she will gladly repeat herself and uploads lots of materials to help students. Highly recommend her! :)

Teach vs Work. As a teacher, she is very outspoken to critique, but for good intentions. Do not be sensitive. She prepares your for reality. Also, she is very sweet and understandable. Just communicate with her and you'll pass. As for the work, stupid easy A. Just do every mini presentation, and clone what her mini projects look like. EASY CLASS!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If you're SENSITIVE and can't handle CRITIQUE - I wouldn't suggest taking this class NOR being a design major. This class is mostly UI theory-based but it shows that a majority of people in class are clearly in the wrong major and blame the professors for their work. She's "rude" AKA critical because of the same mistakes people make every class. :)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Tomita grades horribly and gives no rubric as to how she grades. Her lectures go over vocabulary words only and her slides make no sense if you without the lecture. She does not care about her students and only wants you to learn the vocabulary. I would not take her again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Tomita is a great professor. She teaches you how to apply cognitive psychology theories to your UI design and how to communicate your design choices clearly and concise. These are skills that have helped me in w my internship and freelance work. Weekly stand-ups, 2 med projects, major project, and a short paper, bonus points for writing cntr.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Tomita has been one of the most difficult & stubborn teachers I've ever worked with. The way she grades assignments is very absurd and sometimes irrelevant to the class. Some of her written instructions are unclear and if you misunderstand it, she takes points off. She humiliates students in front of the class and is even rude to faculty members.

She counts off for the smallest mistakes you could make. She also gives you no option to bring your grade up. She can be very moody so beware if you cross her. She WILL call you out if you are on your phone or computer when another student is presenting. Good luck.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader
